channel.title: Qt4 for Windows
channel.description:
Hi der I am in need of Qt4 for Windows...none of this trial shit please. And no torrents either. I did a fair amount of searching on google only to waste all that precious time.
ty sirs
EDIT: fuck I am a retard. nvrmnd lock please btw you should be able to delete a topic if no one has posted in it yet :P
actually nevermind the open source thing is gay. If no one has it I'll have to use that though

item.title: Qt4 for Windows
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can sell your software, it simply has to remain open source (thereby following the GNU/GPL).

Read full topic

item.title: Qt4 for Windows
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:140609”][quote author=juju link=topic=192785.msg1741807#msg1741807 date=1189309439]

QT4 is open source released under the GPL license, why not just use it?

But it’s also proprietary - it must be the anti-christ.
[/quote]

It isn’t proprietary, it is released under GNU/GPL, you can’t get any better than that. :)[/quote]

Only if it’s being used for non-commercial means, if it’s being used for commercial means the royaltiees that need to be paid are rather steep(I think it’s on a per developer basis).

Q: I want to dual license my software too! That means I can use the Open Source edition for development, right?

A: No. In order to write software that will be sold or licensed commercially, in addition to open source, all of your programmers will need a commercial license from the outset of the development phase.

Read full topic

But it’s also proprietary - it must be the anti-christ.[/quote]
